biogHist.abstract: Anna Vroland was an activist and writer who campaigned for Aboriginal rights in the 1940s and 1950s.

archref.repository: State Library of Victoria, Australian Manuscripts Collection
archref.abstract: Printed material related to Aboriginal affairs, 1947-196, and Women's International League for Peace and Freedom. Includes 'Constitution of Aborigines Advancement League (Victoria)', 23 August 1965 and financial statement, 23 August 1966. Also The Council for Aboriginal Rights Report April, 1957; and reports, pamphlets re Aboriginal rights. Also list of members and non-members of Women's International League for Peace and Freedom, 1963 and other printed material.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Records of the Women's International League for Peace and Freedom ( Australian Section)

archref.repository: State Library of Victoria, Australian Manuscripts Collection
archref.unittitle: Records of the Women's International League for Peace and Freedom ( Australian Section)
archref.abstract: Records, 1915-1973, include correspondence, minutes, annual reports, newsletters, photographs and printed items related to Australian and international peace movements. Also includes papers of Anna Vroland and Eleanor Moore and documents concerning WILPF International, Australian Aborigines, conscription and women's rights. Also, correspondence between the New Zealand section of the Women's International League for Peace and Freedom and the Australian section of the same League, 1 July 1958-8 January 1967.

physdesc.physfacet: Correspondence, Minutes, Annual reports, Printed material, Photographs
